Templates

If you are familiar to Django or Octopress, you can easily understand the template engine behind Crotal.

Crotal uses Jinja2 for template engine.

Jinja2

Jinja2 is a modern and designer friendly templating language for Python, modelled after Django’s templates. It is fast, widely used and secure with the optional sandboxed template execution environment.

Two Directories of Template Files

There are two directories for template files, one is public, the other one is themes/[theme_name]/public. Once we generate the site, Crotal will merge the two directories into a single hidden directory named .private.

How Template Engine Works

After merging the two folders, Crotal will process those template files from folder .private, and render those variables into the template files.

For example, template can get access to posts by using this syntax:

<ul>
{% for post in posts %}
<li>{{ post.title }}</li>
{% endfor %}
</ul>

This will be converted to a list of your posts' titles.

There are serveral Variables you can use in any place of the template files.

Name Description Type
config The site's configuration, for example, you can access the site's title by {{ config.title }} Object
posts The list of posts, every post is a Object, access the post's title by {{ post.title }} List of Object
pages The list of pages, every page is a Object, access the page's title by {{ page.title }} List of Object

Template Inheritance

Template Interitance is the most part of Jinja2. It allows you to bulid a base "skeleton" template thant contains all the common elements of your site and defines blocks that child template can overide.

Please check Template Inheritance for more information.

Check the Jinjia2 docs

For further understanding of the Jinjia2 template engine, check the Jinjia2 docs

Template constitution by layout and include

Templates are separated into several different files, when generating the site, they will be formed by two rules: layout and include.

Check Layout and Include for more infomation.
